blocks.text: Four conference tracks will help us cover all of the amazing and important changes in the R & RStudio landscape in only two exciting days. You will hear from some of the most thoughtful practitioners and effective speakers in science, industry, and technology and be able to choose from new, intermediate, and advanced topics. Naturally, we’ll also record everything so you’ll be able to review and see anything you missed, within a few months after the conference. A full list of speakers and complete agenda will be available in September 2019.

We’ve got your favorites and entirely new workshops for rstudio::conf 2020. If you're ready to dive into machine learning, keras and tensorflow, analyzing big data, mastering rmarkdown and dashboards, building powerful shiny applications, creating your own packages, getting started with the tidyverse, or finally learning what no one ever remembers to tell you about working with R, we’ve got you covered. Brand new workshop topics this year include Designing the Data Science Classroom; Text Mining with Tidy Data Principles; Geospatial Computing with R; Time Series and Forecasting in R; R for Excel Users; and JavaScript for Shiny Users. We will also offer advanced administrator and train-the-trainer certifications from RStudio for customers and training partners.
Training Days
250 Northern Ave, Boston, MA 02210  |  844-448-1212  |  conf@rstudio.com

Hilton San Francisco Union Square, located in the Theater District, puts you in walking distance to cable cars and Moscone Center and about 1 mile from Chinatown and Nob Hill. This historic three-tower hotel provides rooms with city views, Cityscape lounge on the 46th floor and an expansive ballroom, ideal for your next special event. Relax on our 16th floor pool deck.
Hotel booking deadline is December 31th, 2019.

rstudio::conf 2020 is all things R & RStudio! Whether you’re a dedicated R user or one of the many people and teams who use RStudio with R and Python, join us in San Francisco, California from Monday, January 27 thru Thursday, January 30 to become better at data science - and have some fun along the way!
January 27 & 28
Pricing
Below are the workshops (Jan 27 & 28) and conference talks (Jan 29 & 30)  for rstudio::conf 2020. Check back for updates!
Or call 1-800-HILTONS  (ask for group code RST)

San Francisco needs no introduction and it always welcomes a good party. One of the world's cultural meccas and home to innovation in the arts, science, and technology, San Francisco offers rstudio::conf 2020 attendees the chance to immerse in the fusion of all three at the California Academy of Sciences on Wednesday, January 29.

The California Academy of Sciences is a must-see San Francisco museum. Based in beautiful Golden Gate Park, it’s the only place on Earth to house an aquarium, planetarium, rainforest, and natural history museum—all under one living roof. From the splashing penguins in African Hall to the wildflowers on the roof, the building is bursting with life. A four-story living rainforest and awe-inspiring coral reef ecosystem showcase Earth’s biodiversity, while immersive planetarium shows offer a new perspective on the planet we call home.
Everyone who comes to learn and enjoy the experience should feel welcome at rstudio::conf.
Inclusiveness Policy
RStudio products have been downloaded by millions of people from all over the world.

We know from our own team and countless events, that RStudio users represent various points on the spectrums of race, color, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, abilities, wealth, language, and politics, that can unite and divide people.
We welcome all who come to learn and enjoy the experience without prejudice and ask attendees to help us make the conference a fantastic time for everyone.
Diversity Policy
RStudio supports the Diversity Charter for technology events. We want our events and the events we attend to both reflect and encourage the diversity of the R community
For example, Google analytics and data from those who have purchased from us suggest:
Someone in every country in the world downloaded software from our website last year.
More than 36% of website visitors are female.
73% of rstudio.com visitors are between the ages of 18 and 35, 23% are between 35 and 55 and 4% are 55+.
Organizations from 45 countries and six continents have purchased RStudio professional products in the past 12 months.
Some of the ways we promote diversity at rstudio::conf 2020 include:
Providing academic pricing and scholarships for students and attendees from developing countries.
Including diversity in the selection criteria for speakers and workshop instructors.
Offering, within the constraints of the venue, optional childcare, gender neutral bathrooms, a lactation room, and a quiet room.
Ensuring that accessible options are available for attendee transportation, hotel rooms, conference rooms, and social events.
Providing keynote live streaming for those unable to attend.
Covering travel expenses and waiving conference fees for Invited Speakers. Waiving conference fees for Contributed Speakers.
Birds of a Feather lunch tables include opportunities for non-English speakers to socialize.
Data Protection Policy

When you register for rstudio::conf we collect certain personal information necessary for registration, payment, and communicating with you about the conference and RStudio. At rstudio::conf attendees may also reasonably expect, as at any public event, to appear in pictures taken by attendees and/or the event’s photographer that may be shared with others at the conference and those following it online. We will not use your personal information for any other purpose without your permission and we will delete any of your information under our control that you identify for us, including photographs, at your request.

For more information, the RStudio Privacy Policy  describes our policies and procedures regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of Personal Information we receive from you. Our treatment of personal data provided by you on our website and at rstudio::conf complies with the General Data Protection Regulation.  At rstudio::conf you can be assured that attendees encounter only non-defaulted opt-ins to marketing and future contact, including from third parties. In addition, third party speakers do not confer ownership of their materials in any way to the event and speakers must opt-in to publication of their materials and have the right to request materials be removed.
Harassment Policy

We expect everyone at rstudio::conf to contribute to a welcoming, civil, safe, and tolerant environment. RStudio is committed to fostering a productive, harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form.
At rstudio::conf:
Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately.

If a participant engages in harassing behavior, event organizers retain the right to take any actions to keep the event a welcoming environment for all participants. This includes warning the offender or expulsion from the conference with no refund.
Event organizers may take action to remedy or set right anything designed to, or with the clear impact of, disrupting the event or making the environment hostile for any participants.

You can make a personal report:

In person: Contact any rstudio::conf staff member or visit the conference registration desk.

When taking a personal report, event staff will ensure you are safe and cannot be overheard. They may involve other event staff to ensure your report is managed properly. This can be uncomfortable, but we'll handle it respectfully and you can bring someone to support you.

By email: Send a message to conf@rstudio.com; event organizers will respond promptly.

By phone: Call 844-448-1212; this phone number will be monitored for the duration of the event.

Our team will help you contact hotel/venue security, local law enforcement, local support (which could include services and transportation as available), or otherwise respectfully assist you to feel safe for the duration of the event.
